author: Special Correspondent
text:
It was a great opportunity for artistes of Tiruchi and nearby areas to participate in Thyagaraja Aradhana organised at Sri Raghavendra Mutt in Srirangam by Tiruchi Kendra of Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan on Sunday.

In all, 24 artistes including 13 vocalists, four mridangam artistes, a violin vidwan, a kanjira artiste participated in the aradhana, which commenced with a flute note by Prapancham Mukhya Prana. They rendered the pancharatna kirtans on the lines of the annual homage at Tiruvaiyaru.

P. Sivakumar, Deputy General Manager, SBI, the chief guest, spoke on the impact of music in general and the pancharatna kirtans in particular, on devotees and listeners for achieving self-purification. T.V. Murali, honorary secretary, said this was the fifth consecutive year that the aradhana was being organised by the Tiruchi Kendra of the Bhavan.

J.T. Chari, director – project, said what started as a small measure five years ago has developed into a major musical event in the city.

Vidwan Kasim, who was the moderator for the programme, explained the significance of Pancharatna kirtans as a key to attaining salvation.
title: Thyagaraja aradhana in Tiruchi
